column3: I think it is confusing if we would use a different term then HD (hierarchical deterministic). We are using HD. The seed is not on the same hierarchical level then the derived keys. We are deriving `m/0'/0'/k'` which is kind of the proposed path after BIP32.\n

ACK the sigops change section.

Regarding the relay influence section:
- I don't think the CB effect is very significant... miners can and will peer with each other, even ignoring things like faster relay network protocols.
- When ignoring non-random-public-P2P-network relay between miners, full nodes have always had influence through policy decisions through the signature cache.
- The strong
Needs merge conflict solved, if still relevant.\n
"HD" is no longer the term used?\n
"HD" is the term for hierarchical deterministic wallets. I am making the observation that Core 0.13's is not really hierarchical. TBD if anyone agrees or if I should back this change out.\n
